name: Radisson Fort McDowell Resort & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in October 2013 for the Javelina Jundred ultra marathon which took place in nearby McDowell Mountain Park. The hotel was perfectly suited for that purpose. It's about 15 minutes away from the Park, and close to a Safeway supermarket, Target, and several other stores. We stayed in a junior suite which had a full size fridge and microwave and sink, but no oven or utensils. There was also a little balcony which had room for two chairs and a small table. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was fairly spacious, had lots of towels, and the showerhead had excellent water pressure. The furnishings are updated and modern.
reviews.title: Excellent stay and well suited as base to travel to and from McDowell Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is pet friendly which is a plus, as we had two dogs with us. There is a dog path outside the hotel around the pool, with dog waste bags available outside. We didn't visit the casino, but we did try out the onsite restaurant for dinner and breakfast, which were very good. They were very accomodating about dietary restrictions and helpful in suggesting alternatives. Room service was very prompt and courteous and the food was quite good (salad and the margherita pizza). The hotel pools were clean, there were plenty of towels, and it was uncrowded and fairly quiet. The outdoor common spaces were beautiful and had plenty of seating. There's a nicely landscaped pathway through the back of the hotel which is xeriscaped and very pleasant. Plenty of free parking. Service was uniformly excellent.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: The only downside was the free wi-fi which was a little slow, there was no ethernet port, and the lack of utensils/plates in the room (we just bought disposable stuff from the nearby Safeway).
reviews.title: Radisson Fort McDowell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that the hotel is between 20-30 minutes from Scottsdale and about 30 minutes from Phoenix so it may be a bit far if you are interested in spending a lot of time in those areas of the city. However, if you're there for a conference, or for an event in the area, it's perfect and very relaxing.
reviews.title: Hotel and Casino well outside the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was really nice looking but I would say fair to good on everything else. The room we stayed in didn't have a microwave and the bathroom was a little small. We stayed at another hotel right before this and it was a little cheaper and better in most aspects. The casino was cool very big, but very smokey. The pool was really nice. We had one of the less expensive rooms so that played a part of it I'm sure but for the price I felt it could have been nicer. It does have a cool sitting area with couches and stuff so that was kind of cool. It is also way out in the boonies which we liked but its something to keep in mind. Again it was pretty good but for the price it could have been better.
reviews.title: Top class hotel

description: Radisson Fort McDowell Resort and Casino offers signature amenities, comfortable accommodations and exciting activities in a stunning Arizona desert oasis near Scottsdale.The resort features views of the majestic Four Peaks, the impressive Red Mountains and more. With a large outdoor pool and two whirlpool spas, fine dining at Anhala Mesquite Room, award-winning golf at We-Ko-Pa Golf Club, the 24-hour McDowell Casino, and much more, families, couples and groups alike are sure to be entertained!Plus, on the land of the Yavapai Nation, explore the Sonoran Desert with Fort McDowell adventures, offering horseback riding, hiking, kayaking, jeep tours and more. Guests can also take part in authentic Yavapai National celebrations.For social events, conferences and weddings, Radisson Fort McDowell’s Wassaja Ballroom offers more than 25,000 square feet of event space and deluxe catering options. With flexible indoor and outdoor event venues, it’s easy to host up to 2,000 guests at this luxury resort.Visitors to the award-winning resort can rest easy with comfortable accommodations featuring plush bedding, complimentary wireless Internet, flat-screen TVs, oversized bathrooms and incredible views of the mountains, pool or golf course.
